website_summaries.verdict: The Intellitouch Xlink Cellular Bluetooth Gateway offers a clever if expensive solution for integrating your cellular line into your home, giving you the freedom to ditch that landline without giving up the comfort of a regular telephone.
pros: The Intellitouch Xlink Cellular Bluetooth Gateway is a cellular docking station that lets you connect your cell phone to a regular telephone
It can be used to pair with as many as three different cell phones and has a host of features
cons: The Intellitouch Xlink Cellular Bluetooth Gateway is a little on the pricey side and may not be necessary for those who dislike talking on regular landline phones

customer_reviews.title: XLink BT Bluetooth Gateway
customer_reviews.text: Installation was very easy. It took about 15 minutes from start to finish which included the "detection" time. I collect vintage telephones and wanted something I could use with older model rotary dial sets. Depending upon the model of the dial set, the ring volume varies but is audible. Dialing out works perfectly. When answering a call, though, it is necessary to wait for a "click" to be heard before you begin conversation. It takes about a second. If using a touch-tone set, be sure that the polarity has not been reversed. Otherwise, the tones may not generate correctly, if at all. Very pleased with this new "toy".
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: This was very easy to install and does work
customer_reviews.text: After getting rid of the landline, I had adjustments to make....where did I leave my phone? or I am upstairs and the phone is downstairs! This was very easy to install and does work! The blue light is very bright and is now my night lite in the upstairs hallway. My phone is now back downstairs and now my cordless rings when I get a call. Sound from the cordless phone isn't all that great but good enough. It may be a bit pricey for this convenience but I do enjoy the lack of exercise running up and down stairs!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Z. Manion

customer_reviews.title: Blown away that this works!
customer_reviews.text: This is for my 93 year old father. It let me use an old landline phone with a nice speakerphone built-in without having landline service, just as advertised! I was surprised that it works EXACTLY like an old-school landline, just pick the landline handset and there is even a dial tone! Just dial your number and the call goes just like a landline. A bluetooth speakerphone would do the same thing, but my father would NEVER be able to figure out the technology. This product uses technology to dumb-down the connections for technophobes to feel right at home. Great product for the elderly. A+
customer_reviews.author: S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Got a defective unit
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it as it was defective. Have an older model which I cannot update with any Windows after Vista, which I no longer have. Wanted to get a newer model which would support newer Bluetooth but while the 2 and 3 ports worked well (answered and made calls) port 1 would answer a call but there was no communication support (just rang and a dead phone). I plan on contacting the manufacturer to see if this is a recurring problem and will re-order and hope for better results. Meanwhile my reconnected old model is working fine on all 3 ports.
customer_reviews.author: F. Kimper

customer_reviews.title: Great for using antique rotary dial phones if you don't have a land line.
customer_reviews.text: This device is really cool and works great. I used it to connect a rotary dial antique desk telephone in my office to my smart phone. The device automatically converts rotary dial clicks to touchtone pulses, which is a nice feature. Sound quality is great. No distortion, echoes, or delays. The range for the Bluetooth is acceptable for my purposes. It was a no-brainer to set up on my smart phone. I had it working within minutes of taking it out of the box. I would strongly recommend this device to anyone who collects antique rotary dial telephones, but no longer has a land line on which to use them.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Give this allot of thought before buying.
customer_reviews.text: This an expensive joke. Your talking on your cell and walk near this device and even though you land line is on the hook, your cell phone connects to the land line phone. And you are disconnected from your cell. It is aggravating. We leave ours off, ecsuse of this auto connect. In theory, it would be great to be able to answer the land line phone. However, this is far more trouble then just using your cell.
customer_reviews.author: M and G California

customer_reviews.title: Makes analog phones work!  Ring and dial.
customer_reviews.text: We have this hooked up to a collection of older Western Electric and baby bell phones. Using Google voice paired with the xlink we can use old analog phones, they ring and rotary dial works. Did this for my grandpa (in his 80s now) he used to work for Western Electric and enjoys collecting and restoring these older phones to this day. I was able to set it up for him and he can use with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Cox

customer_reviews.title: Lots of complaints from the other end.
customer_reviews.text: It works well enough for the purpose, but many complain its hard to understand me on the other end. The person I call sounds perfectly clear and no distortion, so I've not been able to hear what it sounds like on the other end. But in long conversations I end up switch to my Anker Bluetooth head phones and clears it right up. This unit sits about 10 feet away from the phone with no obstructions, while the headphones work 30 feet away or more and through 2 or 3 walls. I got this used for $59. I would NEVER pay the full price for this thing's very poor performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jesuslovesyou101

customer_reviews.title: Acted strange or did not work at all when making ...
customer_reviews.text: Acted strange or did not work at all when making calls. Often scratchy connection. When making a call from the house handset you would hear no ring and a huge delay before connecting. You connect to hear them saying "hello? hello? hello?" or person you are calling would hang up before connection made. Sometimes worked OK - but just not reliable to use day to day on my home phone. Going back to my Vonage voice-over-internet service.
customer_reviews.author: Trystero

customer_reviews.title: Buy USB B to USB A Cable if you want to configure this gateway - NOT INCLUDED
customer_reviews.text: Cannot state whether it works well or at all ---- Since vendor elected to save a few pennies I need to buy USB B to USB A Cable if in order to configure this gateway - NOT INCLUDED Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Long Time Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great when it works
customer_reviews.text: I bought the bluetooth gateway for my grandmother to use with her house phones. It was a quick easy install and the instructions helped a bunch. The device worked flawlessly for 10 months before breaking and becoming unusable. I've spent quite some time trying to get it working again but to no avail. It appears that device will pair with any cell phone, but it won't maintain the connection. We've tried with multiple phones, however the issue still remains. Disappointed in the longevity of the device, was a happy customer before this occurred.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Works really well with my IPhone 8
customer_reviews.text: Works really well with my IPhone 8 and my land line cordless phone and my old 1940s Western electric desk phone with rotary dial. Some Have written that the cell phone Needs to be placed right next to the XLink for it to work. I have found that with my cell phone , I can it have roughly 20 feet away before the sound starts to break up. I’m sure this varies with different cell phones and depends on how strong the Bluetooth signal is from the cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Very simple to use and works great
customer_reviews.text: I was having a hard time trying to find something to connect to our business's old intercom system. We were originally using VoIP which wasn't great for our location. I was trying to use a couple of different Wireless Home Phones, but these were all pretty buggy and didn't give me any options. This is super easy to setup and is straight forward. I was worried from looking at the description and manuals that this wouldn't work with smart phones, but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Page

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have an antique wooden telephone booth with a payphone from the 1930's. This is easy to hook up and makes the phone work perfectly via our cell phones. You can dial out on the rotary phone and it is converted to a touchtone. The telephone even has a dial tone when you pick up the receiver. Great conversation piece and saves money on getting a landline.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does work most of the time.
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth connection can be spotty. I never know when it will required a re-set. It will quit working without warning, but usually will be ok after a total re-boot.
customer_reviews.author: Tsip

customer_reviews.title: Glad I Purchased
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hook up two rotary phones I have. This thing works great and my cell phone connects automatically every time I return home. Great purchase! The only bummer is sometimes the sound is great and sometimes its really fuzzy, it’s always hit or miss.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most are pretty wise ass remarks from them
customer_reviews.text: I have been fighting with this device since I got it. It pairs with an iphone, just doesn't stay paired. Phone rings, then call is gone. Busy signals, dead air, all kinds of noises. If you allow the phone to lock, it doesn't work. If you unlock the phone, you must keep it on charger. Then it works; but only sometimes. I have had several emails with what they call a "support" dept. Most are pretty wise ass remarks from them. Don't waste your money. I would give no stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F

customer_reviews.title: Got rid of landline but can still use my cordless phones!
customer_reviews.text: I could finally get rid of my landline with this nifty gadget. I do not like carrying my cell phone all over the house with me; I prefer a regular sized phone to tuck between my ear and shoulder. I have 3 cordless phones, one on each floor of my house, so when my cell rings, all the phones ring because they sync thru Bluetooth. Easy set up. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tool !!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome to have. I use it for a security system. It allows me to hook up any cell phone with blue tooth to it and then I use the hard line to connect to the alarm as a backup way of calling me if it goes off. I have used it for over a year with no issues. I have called in and called out with no issues. Works great and does not seem to loose Bluetooth connection. I have not had to do any re syncing or rebooting of the devices for almost a year now. I would also recommended you plug this into a batter backup for use during a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Cell phone use on home phones
customer_reviews.text: Xlink BT was extremely easy to set up. and works flawlessly with our home telephones. I set our "home" cell phone near the unit when I get home and then I can call and receive calls from the cell through my house phones. The unit allows you to link 3 separate cell phones to the home phones. There are some areas of our house where cell phone reception is poor, so this allowed me to leave the cell phone in an area where the signal is the strongest.
customer_reviews.author: boesey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device - perfect solution to needing a landline style phone and only paying for cell service
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic - the perfect solution for using a landline style phone with cellular service. My elderly hard of hearing mother needs an amplified landline style phone for which landline service was $75 a month. This device allows her to easily use her cellphone service with her special phone. It works much better than expected - highly recommend! With an iPhone, you are also offered on the iPhone itself whether you want to I answer via the iPhone itself or your Bluetooth connected phone.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey_H

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for us.
customer_reviews.text: Has lost the BT link once or twice, but otherwise is a solid piece of technology. There's no discernible delay or noise caused by it at all. If used in a bedroom - you will want to used some tape/aluminum foil or something to cover the blue light on top - it DOES however make a nice nightlight for other parts of the house!
customer_reviews.author: Carl R. Downey

customer_reviews.title: Phones everywhere are ringing.
customer_reviews.text: Works Ok. My only complaint is the CallerID only shows the phone number and not the name, even when the name shows up on the cellphone. On the house phones "Xlink BT" is what shows up for the name. But this may not be the Xlink device's fault but possibly my cellphone (Samsung Sky) may not be transmitting the name. I am please I am able to answer the phone throughout the whole house. Before I received calls while I was out of hearing range of the cellphone. Now the house phones rings everywhere, even out in the shop.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Bookreader

customer_reviews.title: Xlink BT outstanding voice with Panasonic cordless phone and Samsung cell phones.
customer_reviews.text: Could not hear my cell phones ring through out the house. My wife and I did not want carry the cell phone with us when inside our home. Solution...use Xlink BT Gateway with Panasonic KX TG6513B DECT 6 0 Plus 3 handset cordless phones. Easy setup...no land line required. Just plug Panasonic base station into Xlink. My cell phones stay on charger and connect with Xlink even after coming from garage where my cell phone connected to my car's Bluetooth. Simple plug and play. Now I have cell phones on chargers connected to Xlink BT Gateway and use Panasonic cordless phones in office, kitchen, and master bedroom to talk on.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it worked. Sometimes it didn't. We dropped our land line to go full cellular, but needed a "home phone" for the kids for emergencies...just in case. They are younger. We just kept the cell phone plugged in right next to the gateway. Every now and then when you wanted to make an outgoing call there was no dial tone, and therefore unable to make a call. Considering the only reason to have it was for emergencies for the kids, it kind of defeats the purpose if they can't call 911. It's in a drawer now with a whole bunch of other useless stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: This is a must for homes without a land line.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great concept in a home without a land line. My wife does not carry her phone everywhere she goes, so with this device she can pick up on our old cordless system. The cell phone must be placed close to the device for it all to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Psaint

customer_reviews.title: All I had to do was follow the few instructions and it was pretty much just "plug and play" I can make and ...
customer_reviews.text: It works! All I had to do was follow the few instructions and it was pretty much just "plug and play" I can make and receive calls from my home phone (I have no land line). The sound is the same as if talking on the cell phone directly. It comes with paperwork from the manufacturer with support contact information. So going forward, I have a place to contact if I come into any problems or to find out if there is a new upgrade to download. I previously bought a Cobra B215A and it didn't work. It rang my home phone but I just got dead air when I answered.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Used it for awhile but...
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. Problems: range is limited (not a surprise being its bluetooth), If my cellphone is connected and I answer my cellphone it is slow to disconnect or doesn't disconnect at all and I have to turn it off which means later if I forget to turn it back on it doesn't ring the house phone. Sometimes when I'm on the cellphone talking it auto connects and then I can't hear the caller which is annoying and thus I have to go turn it off (pushing the appropriate blue button on top). After awhile I just quit using it. I should sell the one I have for cheap to someone who wants to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: kcl_pdx

customer_reviews.title: Fun, amazing, and practical.
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says it will. Simple and easy to use. Love having the old rotary phones ringing again.
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about this gadget but a guy at work had it and said it worked great! Also, most of the reviews raved about it. So, I decided to order it and give it a try as I was tired of paying for a cell phone AND a landline. Well, recieved it, paired it with my iPhone (about 30 seconds) and promptyl cancelled my landline! Just keep your cell phone close to the XLink and it will pick up all your phones in the house (you need to have a base phone with handsets assigned to that base). Some people find it hard to believe I am talking on a home phone via XLINK via cell phone!!
customer_reviews.author: Southampton Guy

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit, not very nice support
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something like that for a while and was very exited when I discover this product. Initially it worked great, but over time unit ran out of sync with cell phone. When you answer a call you can hear cell phone ring 3-4 seconds. Unfortunatly the software on company website did not work on three different computers I tried it and my numerous attempts to contact support went unanswered.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN FINKELSHTEYN

customer_reviews.title: Fit the bill
customer_reviews.text: Great little product. They shipped the BTTN unit as opposed to the BT unit. It connects to the 3 cell phones simply and I also have one landline which I connected directly to Line 2 on my Cordless phone system. I also use a dual line Cordless phone system through the house. This allows me to leave the Cell's in a location that has the best signal while roaming the house with the cordless phones. One drawback, if you use your smart phone a lot or Text a lot, then you might be carrying your cell around and drop out of the blue tooth range that connects it to the gateway.
customer_reviews.author: Andy J.

customer_reviews.title: XLink works prefectly
customer_reviews.text: We added the Xlink to our Homesitter freeze alert, as we did not have a landline at your cabin. Setup was very easy and works just as described. We opted for a cheaper Bluetooth enabled pre-paid mobile phone which is a great way to allow for the Homesitter to communicate without needing the landline. This unit does not have any built in batteries (like the Homesitter does) so during a power failure, it will not allow the Homesitter to make calls, alerting you. This is easily solved with the purchase of a small battery backup, plugging this directly into it.
customer_reviews.author: Duramax

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Worked a short while and then it didn't. Unable to pair second phone. Company Customer service could not help. Returned the unit. Never contacted to say unit defective or what went wrong? Disappointing because I really need the functionality. Anyone suggest another brand????
customer_reviews.author: CTM

customer_reviews.title: One flaw, but it works great otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My only issue with it, is that it doesn't seem to pass the called ID info to the phone. Maybe I'm doing something wrong, but calls from my cell show up as "XLink BT" for the name (it does pass the number, however.)
customer_reviews.author: john galt

customer_reviews.title: Why isn't this more popular??
customer_reviews.text: I really had no expectations of this working. But I bought a vintage phone, paired it with device, and in 3 minutes was calling out on it, with calls going thru my iphone.
customer_reviews.author: Jlwleighton

customer_reviews.title: works pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: works pretty well... i like especially that i can get rid of the land line, yet still leverage the land line phone handsets which were wired throughout the house. the only issue is that the call quality isn't quite as good as wired; this seems to improve with cell phone proximity to gateway (i.e. a bluetooth range problem), but it could also have to do with cell line quality as well. on the other hand, it's usually fine, and always good enough.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Chinn

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing how well it works. All cordless house phones are connected to it by plugging the base handset into it, allowing one to just use a cell phone and cancel the landline service. Note that your cell phone needs to be placed very close to the Xlink to get a static-free connection - any more than six feet away and the connection gets interference. When the cell phone is taken out of range, the system disconnects, and will automatically reconnect when the cell phone is brought back within range.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Simple, reliable, high quality - Works exactly as you would expect!
customer_reviews.text: This little box does exactly what it claims and what it should. It is simple to set up and simple to use. The call quality was excellent. Now when I get home I plug my cell phone into the charger on the nightstand and any incoming calls ring through on the phones in my home. I don't have to turn it on or push any buttons. It just happens automatically. Usually gadgets like this type don't really measure up to what they should. This one does. I do recommend downloading the firmware upgrade available for free from their web site. This is just a nifty little device.
customer_reviews.author: Intelligentsia

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of money . Does not appear to work correctly with Nokia 635 Windows phone. Call will go through fine and is OK for a few minutes, but within 3-15 minutes the audio will be lost and will result in a squeal through the receiver for both users even though the bluetooth connection is not lost between the phone and the BT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Allows you to use multiple, traditional land line handsets throughout the house. Inbound and outbound calls work like usual and the land line answering machine also works the way it normally would. Well worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Danckert

customer_reviews.title: But it does great if you don't have car issues
customer_reviews.text: My cell phone kept disconnecting and we had issues with my car's blue tooth. But it does great if you don't have car issues.
customer_reviews.author: Charles B. De Wildt

customer_reviews.title: Could not get it to work reliably with my phone
customer_reviews.text: I have a LG Lucid. I was able to connect the phone with the tech support help. They had to load an older software version. However even with that it was hit or miss. Sometimes it worked just fine and then it didn't even so the light indicated proper connection. Update: I ended up sending it back. A little while later I got an iPhone 5 and ordered another one. With the iPhone 5 the Xlink works like a charm, just plug it in, connect and you're read to go.
customer_reviews.author: Still in Love

customer_reviews.title: Worked with on of my Samsung Galaxy S2 phones
customer_reviews.text: I used it to attach to my house phone wiring even though I don't have a land line. It was easy to setup the by plugging a telephone cable into the box and into the house wall plate. Bluetooth was easy to connect to my phones. However, only one of my phones worked well with the system allowing me to answer and make calls thru my land line phones. Using the land line phones key pad to respond to destination menus would not work occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: R L Shirey

customer_reviews.title: Despite many attempts, it just wouldn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it's just a problem with my parents LG phones, or if its something else entirely, but this thing never worked correctly. I updated the firmware, connected the phones according to the instructions, and it just didn't work right - thankfully, 4 months after my purchase, Amazon accepted the return! Five stars for Amazon, one star for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: XLink installs in a snap allowing me to cut the cord for the land line. Porting my land line to my VZ family plan saved me over $40 per month, more than justifying the cost of the XLink. Nearly perfect becasue: Works GREAT for voice, but I have yet to be able to send or recieve a FAX. I doubt that this is a limitation of the XLink, rather something in the call characteristics of the cellular network - FAX is based on analog transport not CDMA or GSM. I've tried using my HP multi-function device as well as PC Fax application with no success.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Jr.

customer_reviews.title: An electronic item that actually works
customer_reviews.text: This thing works. I have no idea how, but it does. Even an electronic simpleton like me was able to hook it up in minutes. I also emailed a question to Xlink on a Saturday evening about what kind of phones I needed to use throughout the house that would work the best with this item. I was hoping for a reply by the following Monday, but was surprised (shocked) when I received their reply and opinion that same evening.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry N

customer_reviews.title: Finally able to use rotary phone without a landline! Make calls out, too!
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted a rotary phone, but have never had a landline. Now I can pair my iPhone with my rotary phone! Someone calls me, I never miss it because of the rotary phone ringing. I can even use the rotary phone to make a phone call! Just start rotating the dial, complete the 10 individual spins and the iPhone makes the call--as simple as that! Great Christmas gift for anyone with a bluetooth enabled phone.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rollins

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as the landline!
customer_reviews.text: I dropped my landline and just use this great gadget. It is wonderful. I have the regular phones, and when I plug them into the XLink, it is just like having a phone throughout the house. it even has the caller ID on the screen, and the best part is that it rings throughout the house and I don't miss calls that I was forever not hearing on my cell phone. It was easy to connect and there have been no issues. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui Tolin

customer_reviews.title: Works well - Uses your old Landline phone & a cellphone
customer_reviews.text: Great way to use a cheap prepaid cellphone plan instead of a $38 monthly landline. Especially great to keep a live phone where you don't use it enough to justify the bill, but you do actually want a phone there. Easier to set up then it might sound. Uses your old landline phone plus a bluetooth enabled cellphone.
customer_reviews.author: David Nathanson

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Furious (Set-up)
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly intuitive and simple to set-up. Cell range from the device is about the advertised rang of ten feet so this device can be mounted on a wall if desired. It automatically detects when the cell's Bluetooth is in range and connects. Worked perfectly and meets the need at a very reasonable price. This device pays for itself within 2 months of eliminated land line service.
customer_reviews.author: Walter W. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Very simple
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. I had the box opened, plugged into the outlet, bluetooth paired to the phone in under 5 minutes. Its was so effortless, I kept thinking there is something I am missing. The instructions are clear and leave no ambibuty left. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a bluetooth gateway. I ported my home phone to a cell phone, and now can use my landline sets and let the cell phone charged.
customer_reviews.author: Reza Gorji, MD

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with the following caveat
customer_reviews.text: Most of the time it works great. A couple of times I have had to reboot the unit because inbound calls would not be able to connect. After unplugging it and powering back up the unit was fine..It is a wonderful convenience to be able use all my handsets around the house and have just a cellular phone bill..I also have done software upgrades as they become available....All in All a great device.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Works---sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Performance has been variable. The most annoying feature is if your cell is linked, you cannot make a call on it. Our experience is we seem to get incoming rings, but no connection and for outgoing calls, a dial tone, message saying connected, but no connection. I have ended up bypassing the unit and going back to my cell. Have tried tech support and instruction avenues. I work from home so sadly must go back to land land for reliability. Nifty idea if you can make it work for you
customer_reviews.author: Cathie Bigger-Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes it Works, Sometimes It Doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it works fairly well. Sometimes it doesn't, cutting out parts of a conversation. Note: This thing can only be updated by connecting a PC. I have found no way to update its software using a MAC, our home system. Great idea to avoid hauling around cell phones while at home, but still average results.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Pace

customer_reviews.title: Works most of the time
customer_reviews.text: Just okay. Works well with one phone but constantly drops the second device. We ordered this after giving up our land line and found we missed the larger cordless handsets. This products allows us to use our cordless system with 5 handsets. Very convenient in a larger home when you can not always get to the cell phone when it rings.
customer_reviews.author: JustLaura

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and brought our grandfathers old phone back to life (via my iPhone).
customer_reviews.author: Marc R.

customer_reviews.title: Disconnected my Vtech home phone from the land line and ...
customer_reviews.text: Disconnected my Vtech home phone from the land line and connected to the Xlink. Works as advertised. Am able to use the "phone book" set up on the Vteck. Most of the time the Xlink will automatically link to the iPhone, from time-to-time need to go into the iPhone blue tooth menu and initiate the refresh. This is probably more of an issue with the iPhone and not the Xlink.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A "MUST HAVE" device for any Cell Phoned home
customer_reviews.text: XLink BT is an excellent product. I've used mine since Oct. 2011. My new Samsung Intensity III would Pair with XLink but house phone would NOT receive audio. Downloaded latest XWizard and updated the XLink software. (Had to disable AVAST Anti-Virus software to stop XWizard from not responding when trying to update XLink box) Now everything works loud and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald F. Ranc

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: I had to do an update on it as soon as I got this product. but that is no big deal. I does work well with little interference. the only problem I see with it is you have to remember which button you program with which phone. and the other issue I have had is even though you turn off the button for the phone you are using with another bluetooth connection. it will still halfway take over your phonecall

customer_reviews.title: This thing really Works!
customer_reviews.text: I set this up and paired with a cell phone and it worked just as advertised. I purchased a cell phone from Tracesfone for about $10 bucks and set it up with the Xlink and it worked great as a house phone and paired our other two cell phones to the Xlink and it worked great. I will recommend it to anyone who need a cheap house phone number. This thing saves me $ 35 a month.
customer_reviews.author: robert Suffolk

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service from Xtreme Technologies.
customer_reviews.text: The item does not work well. Have redone the paring several times and even updated the firmware as suggested in the manual and just too many problems to list. Tried to get support from the company and that was a joke. Ended up contacting and returning to Amazon for a partial refund.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Device!
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to set up. (using a Samsung Galaxy S). No more carrying my cellphone around in the house. I go home *put the phone on my charger (*irrelevant); the device recognizes that my phone is nearby and majiko presto, I have phone service in the whole house. If the phone rings or I need to make a call, I just use what ever phone is closest to me. And yes there's even a dial-tone when I pick up a house phone. Pays for itself in less than a month if your still paying for a land-line! This is my review, I'm not a paid actor.
customer_reviews.author: Julian U.

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I read some negative comments on this product concerning the issue of listening to static in the line. I was hesitant about buying this product, but I decided to give it a try. I connected the Xlink to a set of Uniden cordless phones and linked it to an Android Moto X with a strong signal and within 10 feet away from the Xlink. For me, this product works as described and have no complaints. My cordless phones work great with a clear sound and I can see the caller id on their display.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: I recently started to do some work from home, but like many had given up the home phone. I put this in to allow me to use my cell over the home phone and speaker. This is one of the few things I have bought that was truly simple to set up and just works as described. It does get a little static if the Iphone or Crackberry my wife has is too far away from the unit, but if you keep it within 5-10 feet reception is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: MaDDaddy

customer_reviews.title: It does work..... Give it a C+
customer_reviews.text: It does work! The issue is when I answer my 'land line' type phone, there is a few seconds delay in the connection that would or might cause the incoming caller to think you have hung up on them. A frequent caller to my home has stated that it is very frustrating due to this problem. It is better than having to carry your cell phone from room to room.
customer_reviews.author: Don H

customer_reviews.title: but worked with Moose so I am very happy.
customer_reviews.text: To my surprise my old alarm system (Moose) is able to dial out through this and notify monitoring center of any alarms. So no more expensive landline since now regular house phones and alarm system just dial out through this gateway and additional cell phone line that was added to the group/family cell plan is 3x cheaper than landline per month. Will pay for itself in 2 months. I am sure that this will NOT work with ALL alarm systems, but worked with Moose so I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leave your cell charging anywhere in the house

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: good bluetooth connectivity, I just put my mobile in a docking charger in the same room, but the bluetooth connection is strong enough to go a little further away. Phone rings and dials as usual... I would advise not to dial too fast. allow a little for conversion. If name is in your mobiles directory, it will appear on home phone screen, otherwise you will see the number only.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Beyer

customer_reviews.title: Well Done!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. It worked exactly as I expected. I bought a cobra phonelynx and was disappointed as it did not pass caller ID/Number information to my home wireless phone system (AT&T DECT) but this works exactly as expected caller information is sent to wireless handsets and displayed correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny A. Chaffin

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: It lets us use our cell phones for the house which saves us money. The reception is also clear, so overall I'm happy with the purchase. However, it's supposed to work with 3 phones and it really only works with 2. When I connect the 3rd cell phone it will kick off one of the others. Also there is a 2 second delay when you answer so the person calling you doesn't hear you say hello. We learned to wait a couple seconds and then say hello and all is well. I would recommend it as an alternative to a land line, it's working for us.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I found this product easy to use and setup. The only negative was the "Caller ID" name not coming through, but there is a workaround. I upgraded to the latest firmware. Also, in the unit's software interface, I went to "Advanced Options" and un-checked something like "send XLINK BT if no caller name". Finally, I added the people I know into my Samsung Solstice cell phone's contact list. Their name from the phone is what is now transmitted to my Xlinked phones (Uniden DECT 6.0). I use a dedicated cell phone that sits beside the Xlink box. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Rick01

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in, pushed a button and entered 0000 into my blackberry when prompted. It was that easy. I have 4 cordless phones, and call display even works (not the name, just the number). Everything automatically reconnects every time I come home. Sound quality is great when my BlackBerry is within 10 ft of unit, but since I usually have it with me I mostly use my BlackBerry to answer calls. There is a slight delay when answering and making calls on cellphone but I rarely miss a call now because all the house phones ring, even when my phone is on silent. The only major drawback is I can't call my cellphone anymore to find it....
customer_reviews.author: enjoyingtime

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my old rotary phone
customer_reviews.text: I use it with an old rotary phone. Works great. Fun to be able to make and receive calls on the old phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W.

customer_reviews.title: RETURN OF 2ND XLINK

customer_reviews.title: Wow!

It is really nice to get rid of the landline and be able to use my house phone wiring to answer my cellphone calls throughout the house. I think that it is a bit on the expensive side. Sound quality not as good as either the land line or the cell phone and there seems to be a slight delay, but worth it.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!

customer_reviews.title: Huge upgrade over GE

Second time , they send me a letter stating they will refund the purchase price. I got X-link and it works fine. Huge improvement is no need to enter any #s the other one required when dialing from home phone. Thumbs up, X-link.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use

Really just plug it in and sync your phone to it. As long as my cell phone is near it it works great, with distance it does get a little scratchy. I would highly recommend this if you want to use an old land line phone with your cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: annm

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The Xlink does exactly what it is supposed to do. It paired quickly with my Blackberry and the sound quality during calls has been good. I have not noticed any interference in using a cheap 2.8 Ghz cordless. I was worried that the unit would not provide enough current to ring the amplified ringer I have attached inline to the phone, but it does this perfectly. I love the fact that it is just a one time set up and then just forget about it. I walk in the door and the Blackberry connects to the Xlink and I walk out to the car and the xlink disconnects and my Motorola T505 connects. I love this thing!

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth Version Incompatiblity Issue Between Cell Phone & XLink Device
customer_reviews.text: I paired this device with Control Products FA-I-CCA Intermediate FreezeAlarm. Once "hooked up", this device works flawlessly. There was some confussion in that I had ordered the model BT and was shipped the model BTTN with no explaination that the BTTN would work in place of the BT. After many hours of trial and error effort, I found the problem to be and incompatible bluetooth version from an older cell phone trying to link up with the XLink device. The two would only stay linked for about 5 minutes. Once I tried my wife's newer cell phone everything worked fine! Also, it wasn't clear (to me at least) that a specific pin number had to be typed in.

product_meta.title: Xtreme Technologies Xlink BT Bluetooth Gateway - Black
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingDitch your land line service with the XLink BT Bluetooth Device, without losing the use of your corded or cordless phone systems at home or in your office. All cell phones with Bluetooth wireless technology will work with XLink. 
The XLink family of products make it possible to send and receive cell phone calls using regular telephones. No more searching for your cell phones - just use regular phones at home or in the office. 
Use your cell phone's service plan from the comfort and convenience of your home phones. Take advantage of carry-over minutes, free nights and weekends, mobile to mobile, unlimited calling plans and free long distance from our cell phone service provider.
The XLink does not have a monthly or annual fee. All calls are placed using your cell phone's plan. No new number or contract is necessary.
The XLink works with existing wired and wireless phones. No new equipment is needed.
Many homes and offices have dead spots. The XLink allows you to keep your cell phone in a location with good reception. Calls can then be made from anywhere in the home on your existing home phone equipment.
The XLink can simultaneously connect to three different cell phones - one for each family member. As many standard telephones as desired can be plugged into the back of the XLink. Whenever any of the connected cell phones ring, all the standard telephones ring as well.
feature_bullets: Answer cell phone calls on home telephones
Connects up to three cell phones to regular home telephones
Wireless - when cell phones are placed within range, the XLink automatically connects to them
